intro: Ackermannia, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It consists of a single species, Ackermannia montana, which is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, often hairy leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbels. It is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Ackermannia is considered a rare and specialized plant with limited distribution.
